pr_title: SONARJAVA-3337 Remove references to SonarJava in repository and plugin

timeline.message: Drop useless tests: sonarjava_feedback has been removed

timeline.bodyText:
Let's use since plugin version to be consistent with the others.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * @deprecated since version 5.12 - Use key of InputFile instead, using {@link #getInputFile()}.
          
          
            
               * @deprecated since plugin version 5.12 - Use key of InputFile instead, using {@link #getInputFile()}.
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText:
VersiOn ?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                * `org.sonar.plugins.java.api.JavaResourceLocator`: The following method has been dropped (deprecated since VersiOn 4.1), without replacement.
          
          
            
                * `org.sonar.plugins.java.api.JavaResourceLocator`: The following method has been dropped (deprecated since version 4.1), without replacement.

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if we should change this (see discuss).
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.message: SONARJAVA-3337 Remove references to SonarJava from documentation and logs

timeline.bodyText:
could we also drop the trailing "plugin"? i.e.

... the SonarSource Analyzer for Java, you will sometimes notice the use  of...
timeline.author: ganncamp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ If it passed...
 
 When writing custom Java rules, you can only use classes from package [`org.sonar.plugins.java.api`](https://github.com/SonarSource/sonar-java/tree/5.12.1.17771/java-frontend/src/main/java/org/sonar/plugins/java/api).
 
-When browsing the existing 500+ rules from the SonarJava plugin, you will sometime notice use of some other utility classes, not part of the API. While these classes could be sometime extremely useful in your context, **these classes are not available at runtime** for custom rule plugins. It means that, while your unit tests are still going to pass when building the plugin, your rules will most likely make analysis **crash at analysis time**.
+When browsing the existing 500+ rules from the SonarSource Analyzer for Java plugin, you will sometime notice use of some other utility classes, not part of the API. While these classes could be sometime extremely useful in your context, **these classes are not available at runtime** for custom rule plugins. It means that, while your unit tests are still going to pass when building the plugin, your rules will most likely make analysis **crash at analysis time**.

timeline.author: ganncamp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -531,8 +531,8 @@ public interface JavaFileScannerContext {
 
 ## References
 
-* [SonarJava documentation](https://docs.sonarqube.org/display/PLUG/SonarJava)
+* [Analysis of java code documentation](https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/analysis/languages/java/)
